content.description: Start with both hands on a sloper about 6ft right of the NE arete. Traverse left to the arete and find a way up.
content.location: NE cornerÂ of the Large boulder just downhill of the middle of the parking lot.

climbs.name: Unknown between Choplifter and Giraffes in the Air

content.description:
Start on the big flat edge and with terrible patina edge feet. Cross up and left onto a fantastic incut edge, then pick your way to the top.

It's really fun to go up and left to a cool sloper, then back right to the jug rail.

Also fun to match on the crimp, then move up and right onto a smaller incut edge, then bump to the rail.

You could probably do 5 more eliminates on this little face. Including starting on the big rail and moving out left to finish Choplifter.
content.protection: 2 pads to build up the lower half of the landing
content.location: This is the problem immediately to the right of Choplifter.

content.description: Start with left hand on the arete and right hand on a thin bit of gaston. Carefully establish on the face and figure out how to move up into the shot hole features, then top out
content.location:
On the S side of the SW arete on the boulder with The Lesbian (the smooth vertical feature with the obvious edge around the corner).

Just downhill from the E end of the parking lot across from the historical signs.

content.description:
Originally listed as a V2 in the guide, but Mike B suggested the left line is more V4, and the V2 goes straight up and right after hitting the jug

Start on an incut edge for the left hand and a left facing crimp for the right, do a balancey move to the jug, then traverse left up along the seam using slim feet and tricky hands to the chicken head, then top out.
content.location: On the E face of the large boulder just S of the middle of the parking lot

content.description: Start with right hand on a crimpy side pull, and left hand on a little bit of almost nothing. Do a hard pull to hold the start, then move up into slopers and work your way straight up. Gets easier as it goes.
content.location: Middle of the S Face of the large boulder just S of the Parking Lot. It has a noticeable left slanting seam on the E face.

content.description:
Start low on side pulls just left of the crack, move out left and up the bulge.

Sort of like Bear Hug Stand across the street, but more moves that are more straightforward.
content.location: SW corner of the Chunky Boulder (just E of the parking lot on the N side of the trail)

content.description:
Mentioned in the BB as a good face to climb. The natural start is on some good slopers just left of the NE arete. Move up and left to right facing crimps, then straight up to more crimps and the lip. The feet are good to start, but get tricky a few moves in.

The top is high and the landing is uneven, bring 4-5 pads to level it out and a spotter or two.

nice view from the top.
content.protection: 4-5 pads and a spotter or two.
content.location:
On Overlook Boulder which is about 200 yds up hill south across the creek from the power station.

Green Eggs is on a greenish slab on the East face just left of the NE arete.

content.description: Sit start on a crimpy rail and double dyno left to the scoopy lip.
content.location: W face of the Chunky Boulder, which is just E of the parking lot on the N side of the trail
